summary: This bill, the Giving Alien Migrants Back through Lawful Excise Redistribution Act (GAMBLER Act), proposes amending the Internal Revenue Code to establish a Border Enforcement Trust Fund. This fund would be financed by taxes collected under Chapter 35 and used to support U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) operations, including apprehension, detention, and removal of illegal aliens. The bill's stated purpose is to reduce the financial burden of these activities on American citizens.
